steps.title: Lay the shirt face-down on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay the shirt face-down on a flat surface. Carefully smooth out any wrinkles with your hands. Smoothing out wrinkles is an essential step. Rolling creases into a shirt will cause the wrinkles to set. You should only roll medium-weight shirts. Delicate and stiff materials will wrinkle. If you do roll shirts made from delicate and stiff materials, you will have to iron or dry clean these shirts before wearing them. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the sleeves towards the center.
steps.content: Fold the sleeves towards the center. Take the left sleeve and fold it in towards the shirt’s center. Take the right sleeve and place it on top of the left sleeve. Smooth out any wrinkles with your hands. If you are rolling a long sleeve shirt, fold the sleeves diagonally across the back of the shirt so that they form an “X.” Smooth out any wrinkles. If you are folding a collared shirt, unfold the collar. Smooth out any wrinkles. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the shirt.
steps.content: Roll the shirt. Grab the bottom hem and fold it up approximately one inch. Smooth out any wrinkles. Roll the shirt from the hem to the collar as tightly as desired. As you roll, continue to smooth out wrinkles. You can store your rolled shirts in a drawer. If you are packing for a trip, place your rolled shirts in a 1 gallon plastic bag. This will prevent the shirts from unrolling. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place the pants on a flat surface.
steps.content: Place the pants on a flat surface. Set down the pants so that the waist is closest to you. With your hands, carefully smooth out the wrinkles. Neglecting to smooth out wrinkles will cause the creases to set. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the pants in half.
steps.content: Fold the pants in half. When you fold the pants, the back pockets should be facing out. Use your hands to smooth out the material. Avoid rolling pants made from materials that are prone to wrinkle, like linen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the pants.
steps.content: Roll the pants. Starting at the waist, tightly roll the pants towards the hem of each pant leg. While you roll, smooth out any wrinkles that appear. To keep your roll straight and even, roll the pants with two hands. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Set the skirt on a flat surface.
steps.content: Set the skirt on a flat surface. Position the skirt so that the top is facing up and the waist is closest to you. Smooth out the material to remove any wrinkles and creases. If you roll creased material, the wrinkles will set in the fabric. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the skirt in thirds.
steps.content: Fold the skirt in thirds. Fold the left side of the skirt over the item’s center. Place the right side of the skirt on top of the left side. Between each fold, smooth out the material. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the skirt.
steps.content: Roll the skirt. Use two hands to roll the skirt from the waist to the hem. While you roll, smooth out any wrinkles that appear. Roll away from your body, not towards your body. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Place the item in a plastic garment bag.
steps.content: Place the item in a plastic garment bag. Put the wrinkle-prone item on a hanger. Slip a plastic garment bag over the item. The garment bag will help prevent the item from wrinkling. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Lay the garment bag on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay the garment bag on a flat surface. Place the item so that the hanger is furthest away from you. Take time to smooth out wrinkles in the item and garment bag with your hands. Smoothing out the creases and folds will protect your garment from set-in wrinkles. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Fold and roll the garment bag.
steps.content: Fold and roll the garment bag. Fold the left and right sides of the garment bag in towards the center. Fold up the excess plastic at the bottom of the bag. Starting at the hem, loosely roll the item up towards the hanger. As you fold and roll the item, smooth out any wrinkles or creases that appear. [12] X Research source
